alert.note: Alert for Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 6:53PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of snow showers will affect southeastern Aroostook and north central Penobscot Counties... At 652 PM EST...An area of snow showers was along a line extending from 9 miles south of Bridgewater to Shin Pond...and moving southeast AT 30 MPH. Locations impacted include... Houlton, Patten, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Smyrna, Amity, Mount Chase, Haynesville, Sherman Station, Cary Plantation, Shin Pond, Smyrna Mills, Dudley Township, Reed Plantation, northeastern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Littleton, Linneus, Monticello and Oakfield. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 258 and 304. US Highway 1 between Orient and Littleton. State Highway 11 between Sherman and Patten. * Winds in excess of 35 mph are possible with this area of snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of snow showers, with local white-out conditions. Temperatures will turn sharply colder following the snow and will cause any water or slush to quickly freeze on roads and sidewalks. Untreated road surfaces will become extremely slippery. Reduced speeds and distance between vehicles is advised.
